title: Augusta County: A. J. Gilkeson to Gilkeson's brother (probably Hugh Gilkeson), October 6, 1862
summary: Gilkeson updates his brother on the health of his family and remarks upon the excitement of the times. He then devotes considerable space to discussing conscription and the reasons that he believes his brother should employ a substitute (he emphasizes the need to stay home as a father).
keywords: Enlistment, Family, Home Front, Military Authority, National Government, Women, American Civil War
